info.description:
This is Wild Apricot's API for administrators. You can use it if you already have a Wild Apricot account (typically with a website on  *.wildapricot.org). Otherwise, please use https://register.wildapricot.com to create a new account.

If you have any questions about this API, please contact our support team at support@wildapricot.com.
info.title: Wild Apricot Admin API

get.summary: Base URL for specific API version.
get.description: base URL for specific API version. It provides a list of resources that can be directly accessible by URL without providing any additional information like account ID etc.
List of accounts available with current oAuth token. Typicaly here would be only one record in an array

get.description:
Contacts search can be executed in synchronous and asynchronous manner. It depends on $async query string parameters.
  # Synchronous call
  When API call is processing synchronously, then response is just an array of contacts.
  To make a synchronous contacts search, client application should make a request with query string parameter **$async=false**.

  `GET https://api.wildapricot.org/v2/accounts/{account_id}/contacts?$async=false&OTHER_QUERY_PARAMS`

  # Asynchronous call
  Contacts search is processed asynchronously by default. So if client application specifies $async=true, or does not specify this parameter at all, the request is processed as described below. In this case contacts search is a two-step action.
  - **Search request**. Client specifies search conditions and receives resultId. See $filter and $select parameters for filtering.
  - **Retrieve result**. Client passes resultId and receives request processing status and contacts list if request is already processed

![async contact search diagramm](http://localhost:8019/Content/swagger/WAFiles/ContactListAsyncCall.png)

parameters.name: $async
parameters.description: Controls whether the API call is perform asynchronously. Default value if true.

parameters.name: resultId
parameters.description: This parameter is used on a second step of asynchronous search. It should equal to the value of ResultId in response to the first step of asynchronous search.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Filters the results of the Contacts API call so that only those records that match the filter criteria are included.
See [Filtering the results](http://gethelp.wildapricot.com/en/articles/502#filtering) for details.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Controls which fields are returned in the Contacts API call.

parameters.name: $sort
parameters.description:
Ordering expression. There are 2 sorting options - **Name** and  **MemberSince**. And also 2 direction modifiers - **asc** and **desc**.
---
Example of valid expression - MemberSince asc

parameters.name: simpleQuery
parameters.description: simpleQuery is a parameter which allows you to search for contacts by matching a substring in first name, last name, organization, email or phone. This is simpler than using $filter parameter.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description:
'Specifies the number of records to skip (not include in a result set). For example if you expect about 300 records in result set and want to get them in small portions, you could make do so with 3 calls:'
- ...&$top=100 - will return records from 0 to 99 - ...?$skip=100&top=100' - will return records from 100 to 199 - ...?$skip=200' - will return records from 199 to the end

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: this parameter specifies the maximum number of entries to be returned

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Specifies that the result should contain only a total number of records matching criteria. Requests with specified $count parameter are always processed as synchronous.

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: When idsOnly specified, the API returns only a list of identifiers matching criteria.

200.description: A wrapper object, which contains a list of contacts, contact identifiers, contacts count or information about asynchronous search request.

400.description: On invalid parameters. See error details in response body.

401.description: oAuth token was not provided, invalid or does not provide access to requested URL.

429.description: Too many requests from same account. Wait for a minute and try again.

post.summary: Create a new contact or member record

parameters.name: contact
parameters.description:
- Values for read-only or unrecognized fields will be ignored.
- In order to **assign membership**
  - set MembershipEnabled=true
  - set MembershipLevel.Id to id of desired level

- In order to **assign bundle** membership
  - set MembershipEnabled=true
  - set MembershipLevel.Id to id of some bundle level
  - set 'Member role' field value to json '{ "Label": "ROLE" }' where ROLE is "Bundle administrator" or "Bundle member"
  - For bundle member set field 'Bundle ID' to value of bundle identifier. The bundle ID is returned by the [Bundles API call](https://gethelp.wildapricot.com/en/articles/504) when using it to retrieve bundle information for a particular membership level.

get.summary: List of custom fields related to contacts and members.

This list contains a list of fields of 2 different types.
 - System fields are defined by Wild Apricot system and cannot be removed.
 - Custom fields can be defined by administrator to store some data specific to your account.

post.description:
Picture can be uploaded using multipart/form-data POST request (contains Content-Type header set to 'multipart/form-data'). A multipart/form-data request contains a series of parts, each representing a picture. Each part is expected to contain a "Content-Disposition" header whose value is "form-data". One of its properties (Name, FileName) must be set and have unique value. In case of similar values, only one of those part will be used, others will be dropped. For example, you have uploaded 2 pictures with same Name set to "name". If they have different FileName set, it's ok, but if FileName properties are same as well, only one of those pictures will be saved and available for further processing. Keep this in mind.
Limitations:
  - Maximum size for one uploaded picture is 10mb.
  - Maximum request length is 10mb. It means that you can upload one 10mb picture or 10 pictures 1mb each.
  - Maximum dimensions for uploaded picture are not set, but each picture will be resized to 110px after uploading.
  - Supported picture types are: png, jpeg, bmp. Bmp pictures will be converted to png format.
  - Time period after uploading when picture would be available for use is 30 minutes.
  - Each uploaded picture can be used only once. After first usage it will be removed permanently.
  - Mime type must be 'image' and must correlate to picture type. If you upload the 'png' with 'image/bmp' mime type set, this picture will be dropped.
  - In case of uploading several pictures in one request either 'Name' or 'FileName' property of Content-Disposition header must be set. Otherwise the picture will be dropped.

200.description: Response is simple json object which contains picture guids (see example)

parameters.name: $async
parameters.description: Controls whether the API call is perform asynchronously. Default value if true.

parameters.name: resultId
parameters.description: This parameter is used on a second step of asynchronous search. It should equal to the value of ResultId in response to the first step of asynchronous search.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Filters the results of the Events API call so that only those records that match the filter criteria are included.
The following filter criterias are supported:

  - Id, Supported operations: in.
  - RegistrationEnabled, Supported operations: eq, ne.
  - IsUpcoming, Supported operations: eq, ne.
  - Tags, Supported operations: in.
  - StartDate, Supported operations: eq, ne, gt, ge, lt, le.
  - EndDate, Supported operations: eq, ne, gt, ge, lt, le.
  - Name, Supported operations: eq, ne, substringof.
  - TextIndex, Supported operations: substringof.

parameters.name: $sort
parameters.description:
This parameter can be used to sort list of IDs or list of events. Possible values are

  - ByStartDate asc - sort events by their Start date. Ascending order.
  - ByStartDate desc - sort events by their Start date. Descending order.
  - ByStartSession asc - sort events by start of their sessions (if exists). All past events ignored

  Example: $sort=ByStartDate asc

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description:
'Specifies the number of records to skip (not include in a result set). For example if you expect about 300 records in result set and want to get them in small portions, you could make do so with 3 calls:'
- ...&$top=100 - will return records from 0 to 99 - ...?$skip=100&top=100' - will return records from 100 to 199 - ...?$skip=200' - will return records from 199 to the end

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: this parameter specifies the maximum number of entries to be returned

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Specifies that result should contain only a total number of records matching criteria. Requests with specified $count parameter are always processed as synchronous.

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: When idsOnly specified, the API returns only a list of identifiers matching criteria.

200.description: A wrapper object, which contains a list of events, event identifiers or events count.

get.description: There are 3 parameters, which cannot be used simultaneously. API uses only one parameter of contactId, eventId, $filter or ids exactly in this order. For example if request contains both contactId and eventId, then API uses only contactId to filter event registrations.  Request parameter is required

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Filters the results of the Events API call so that only those records that match the filter criteria are included. The following filter criterias are supported:
  - Id, Supported operations: in.
    example: ?$filter=id in [1,2,3,4.]

get.summary: Get list of invoices by criteria.
get.description: There are 3 parameters, which cannot be used simultaneously. API uses only one parameter of contactId, eventId and eventRegistrationId exactly in this order. For example if request contains both contactId and eventId, then API uses only contactId to filter invoices.

parameters.name: contactId
parameters.description: Identifier of contact to whom the invoice is assigned.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: Identifier of event. When specified API returns collection of invoices associated with event registrations for the event.

parameters.name: eventRegistrationId
parameters.description: Identifier of event registration. When specified API returns invoice related to the registration. Usually a single invoice.

parameters.name: unpaidOnly
parameters.description: When set to true, API returns only unpaid invoices.

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: When set to true, API returns only collection of identifiers instead of collection of invoices.

parameters.name: StartDate
parameters.description: Limits result to invoices created since StartDate.

parameters.name: EndDate
parameters.description: Limits result to invoices created before EndDate.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description:
'Specifies the number of records to skip (not include in a result set). For example if you expect about 300 records in result set and want to get them in small portions, you could make do so with 3 calls:'
- ...&$top=100 - will return records from 0 to 99 - ...?$skip=100&top=100' - will return records from 100 to 199 - ...?$skip=200' - will return records from 199 to the end

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: this parameter specifies the maximum number of entries to be returned

200.description: Collection of invoices that match criteria.

400.description: On invalid parameters. See error details in response body.

401.description: oAuth token was not provided, invalid or does not provide access to requested URL.

parameters.name: EndDate

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: You can filter the refunds by specifying a set of refund IDs.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description:
'Specifies the number of records to skip (not include in a result set). For example if you expect about 300 records in result set and want to get them in small portions, you could make do so with 3 calls:'
- ...&$top=100 - will return records from 0 to 99 - ...?$skip=100&top=100' - will return records from 100 to 199 - ...?$skip=200' - will return records from 199 to the end

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: this parameter specifies the maximum number of entries to be returned

429.description: Too many requests from same account. Wait for a minute and try again.

get.description:
List filter has limitations.
 - if filterObjectType is set then FilterObjectId must be set too.
 - empty filter not allowed (none of filterObjectType, FilterObjectId, StartDate and EndDate are set).

parameters.name: filterObjectType
parameters.description: Kind of object for audit log filter

parameters.name: StartDate
parameters.description: Limits result to log items created since StartDate.

parameters.name: EndDate
parameters.description: Limits result to log items created before EndDate.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description:
'Specifies the number of records to skip (not include in a result set). For example if you expect about 300 records in result set and want to get them in small portions, you could make do so with 3 calls:'
- ...&$top=100 - will return records from 0 to 99 - ...?$skip=100&top=100' - will return records from 100 to 199 - ...?$skip=200' - will return records from 199 to the end

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: this parameter specifies the maximum number of entries to be returned

200.description: An array of audit log item descriptions

429.description: Too many requests from same account. Wait for a minute and try again.

parameters.description:

- ...&$top=100 - will return records from 0 to 99 - ...?$skip=100&top=100' - will return records from 100 to 199 - ...?$skip=200' - will return records from 199 to the end

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: this parameter specifies the maximum number of entries to be returned

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: To get only a list of email identifiers as a result of search request.

200.description: Contains a list of sent emails or list of identifiers, depending on idsOnly parameter value.

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: Should be set to true in order to get only a list of email identifiers as a result of search request.

200.description: A wrapper object, which contains a list of sent emails. also contains EmailDraftIdentifiersResult if idsOnly parameter is true

Unexpected error

get.summary: Get information about feature availability for specific account.
get.description:
There is no way to get full list of features, so api client should know feature identifier. For any invalid featureId API will return {"Allowed":true}.
This method is reserved **_for internal use only_** and not expected to be used by third party client applications.

OAuth2_password.description:
Use this authentication flow to get oauth token by providing user credentials.
clientId and clientSecret should be taken from Authorized applications page in admin backend.

For example if your email is admin@yourdomain.com and password is 123456.
you should pass
`username=admin@yourdomain.com&password=12345&&scope=auto`

scopes.auto: autodetect allowed scopes based on current user permissions

OAuth2_clientCredentials.description:
Use this authentication flow to get token by providing API key.
For example is your ApiKey is o9q834ywiefyywo34yt you should pass values:
clientId=APIKEY&clientSecret=o9q834ywiefyywo34yt

scopes.auto: autodetect allowed scopes based on current user permissions

OAuth2_autorizationCode.description: Use this flow to get token by authorization through your organization website login form. _This authorization mode can not be used from SwaggerHub interface._ - Replace YOUR_ORGANIZATION with valid domain name. - Allow SSO for your authorized application. - Add your web application redirect url to list of trusted domains for that application. See also `http://gethelp.wildapricot.com/en/articles/200`

scopes.auto: autodetect allowed scopes based on current user permissions

Name.description: The account name. This corresponds to the organization name as it appears on the Organization details screen.

PrimaryDomainName.description: The primary domain name for the account.

CurrentContactsCount.description: Number of contacts currently in database (archived excluded)

BillingPlanContactsLimit.description: Maximum number of contacts allowed by billing plan.

ContactLimitInfo.description: Details about limits on the number of contacts.

Allowed.description: Indicates whether the feature is allowed

IntegrationEnabled.description: Is integration enabled in admin UI.

SquareRegisterSettings.description: Settings for Square Register integration, used for mobile app

ZoneId.description: Time zone id, i.e. "Arabic Standard Time"

UtcOffset.description: Offcet from UTC Time in minutes, i.e. "180"

FieldName.description: Field name title, could be displayed in user interface. Field name could be changed by account administrator.

SystemCode.description: System-defined code associated with field. It does not change even if FieldName is edited in admin backend.

DisplayType.description: Optional hint, which tells how to display and edit field. It appears for String and Choice fields.

IsSystem.description: Field is system-defined and could not be deleted. However, field name could be changed by account administrator.

AdminOnly.description: Indicates that the field is accessible only by administrators.

Description.description: System-defined description of the field. Empty for custom fields.

FieldInstructions.description: Admin-defined comment for the field. Shown as a tip when members or visitors fill in forms.

AllowedValues.description: If field value is limited to set of predefined values, this contains list of allowed values. Normally, AllowedValues appear for MultipleChoice and Choice fields.

Order.description: Sorting order to display the field in UI

message.description: An explanation of why this error occured

details.description: More information about the error. Data structure is specific for each kind of error.

FieldName.description: Field title. Custom field names are defined by account adinistrator. System field names are predefined by Wild Apricot system.

SystemCode.description: The system code is a unique field identifier that can be used instead of the field name to identify the field. While field name could be changed by administrators, system codes are defined by the system and cannot be changed.

Value.description: Field value could be an integer / string / date in ISO8601 format / boolean / an object consisting of Id and Label or array of such objects. The content format depends on custom field description.

Url.description: API url to get item details

AllowedOperations.description:
Collection of allowed operations for this resource. Possible values are
GET - Resource can be requested
POST - Resource can be created
PUT - Resource can be updated
DELETE - Resource can be deleted

DisplayName.description: Combination of names or organization or email. Value depends on presence of values. It could be used to display contact record on lists.

FirstName.description: Shortcut for custom field value with system code 'FirstName'

LastName.description: Shortcut for custom field value with system code 'LastName'

Email.description: Contact primary email, shortcut for custom field value with system code 'Email'. Should be unique in account.

Organization.description: Shortcut for custom field value with system code 'Organization'

Status.description: The status of the contact's membership. The status is only included in the results if the contact is a member.

allOf.description: Information about current membership level assigned to the contact. If the contact is not a member, then the MembershipLevel field is not included in the results.

IsAccountAdministrator.description: Indicates if the contact is an account administrator.

TermsOfUseAccepted.description: Indicates if the contact already accepted Wild Apricot's terms of use.

ParticipantsCount.description: The number of members in the bundle.

allOf.description: Link to bundle administrator.
Link to membership level related to this bundle.

SpacesLeft.description: If bundle size is limited, then this field indicates number of vacant spaces left in the bundle.

Members.description: Collection of links to members of the bundle.

FirstName.description: Shortcut for custom field value with system code 'FirstName'

LastName.description: Shortcut for custom field value with system code 'LastName'

Organization.description: Shortcut for custom field value with system code 'Organization'

Email.description: Contact primary email, shortcut for custom field value with system code 'Email'. Should be unique in account.

DisplayName.description: Combination of names or organization or email. Value depends on presence of values. It could be used to display contact record on lists.

ProfileLastUpdated.description: Timestamp of last contact details modification. Complies with ISO8601 format. The date and time that common fields, membership fields, or member group participation were last updated for the contact.

allOf.description: Information about current membership level assigned to the contact. If the contact is not a member, then the MembershipLevel field is not included in the results.

MembershipEnabled.description: Indicates whether the contact is a member. A value of false indicates that the contact is a not a member or is a suspended member.

Status.description: The status of the contact's membership. The status is only included in the results if the contact is a member.

IsAccountAdministrator.description: Indicates if the contact is an account administrator.

TermsOfUseAccepted.description: Indicates if the contact already accepted Wild Apricot's terms of use.

FieldValues.description: For each custom field you have added to your Wild Apricot database, the name of the field, its system code, and its value for this contact are returned. The system code is a unique field identifier that can be used instead of the field name to identify the field. As well, a number of system fields are returned. If a custom field is restricted to certain access levels, then CustomAccessLevel indicates the level to which the field is restricted. Possible values are AdminOnly, Member, and Public.

FirstName.description: Shortcut for custom field value with system code 'FirstName'

LastName.description: Shortcut for custom field value with system code 'LastName'

Organization.description: Shortcut for custom field value with system code 'Organization'

Email.description: Contact primary email, shortcut for custom field value with system code 'Email'. Should be unique in account.

DisplayName.description: Combination of names or organization or email. Value depends on presence of values. It could be used to display contact record on lists.

ProfileLastUpdated.description: Timestamp of last contact details modification. Complies with ISO8601 format. The date and time that common fields, membership fields, or member group participation were last updated for the contact.

allOf.description: Information about current membership level assigned to the contact. If the contact is not a member, then the MembershipLevel field is not included in the results.

MembershipEnabled.description: Indicates whether the contact is a member. A value of false indicates that the contact is a not a member or is a suspended member.

Status.description: The status of the contact's membership. The status is only included in the results if the contact is a member.

IsAccountAdministrator.description: Indicates if the contact is an account administrator.

TermsOfUseAccepted.description: Indicates if the contact already accepted Wild Apricot's terms of use.

FieldValues.description: For each custom field you have added to your Wild Apricot database, the name of the field, its system code, and its value for this contact are returned. The system code is a unique field identifier that can be used instead of the field name to identify the field. As well, a number of system fields are returned. If a custom field is restricted to certain access levels, then CustomAccessLevel indicates the level to which the field is restricted. Possible values are AdminOnly, Member, and Public.

ContactFieldAccessLevel.description: Indicates who is allowed to view the field value. - **Public** - value is visible to anyone who has access to members directory - **Members** - value is visible only to members - **Nobody* - value is visible only to account administrators

AdminOnly.description: Indicates that the field is accessible only by administrators.

ExistsInLevels.description: If field is defined for specific levels only, this contains list of membership levels.

MemberOnly.description: Indicates whether the field is a membership field.

IsBuiltIn.description: The field is a built-in system field, it cannot be edited or deleted.

SupportSearch.description: Indicates that this field can be used in $filter expression in contact search.

IsEditable.description: Indicates that the field's value can be changed with create/update requests. Otherwise value cant be edited through API. If non-editable field value is provided in create/update contact request, the value is ignored by API.

ProrateInApplication.description: If the field has associated cost, this indicates if the cost should be prorated over a partial period of time.

ContactIdentifiers.description: List of contact identifiers that match request criteria. The field appears only if idsOnly parameter was passed in request.

ResultUrl.description: URL to check async result availability. We expect that client application will check this URL with some small delay (every 5 sec) until API returns a list of contacts or ProcessingState==Failed.

Requested.description: Date and time when the request was queued for processing.

Processed.description: Date and time when the request was processed.

ProcessingState.description: Asynchronous request state. It starts from Waiting, then server process it. Request may end in one of final states: Complete or Failed.

ErrorDetails.description: In case of error, provides description of error occured.

Count.description: Number of contacts that match request criteria. This field appears only if $count parameter was passed in request.

Contacts.description: List of contacts that match request criteria.

MemberOnly.description: Indicates whether a field is available only to members.

FirstName.description: Shortcut for custom field with system code 'FirstName'

LastName.description: Shortcut for custom field with system code 'LastName'

Organization.description: Shortcut for custom field with system code 'Organization'

Email.description: Contact primary email, shortcut for custom field with system code 'Email'. Should be unique in account.

MembershipEnabled.description: Indicates whether the contact has membership. False means that the contact is a not a member or the membership is suspended.

Status.description: The status of the membership. The status is only included in the results if the contact is a member.

Password.description: New password to assign. If you don't want to change password, just skip this field.

FieldValues.description: An array of field values to assign to contact.

RecreateInvoice.description: Indicates whether to create invoice is required. Default value is **TRUE**

FieldName.description: New field name. Must be unique.

IsRequired.description: Indicates whether a field has to be filled before the form is submitted. This limitation affects member-facing functionality only, admin always can submit form even without required fields.

AdminOnly.description: Indicates that the field is accessible only by administrators.

FieldInstructions.description: Shown as a tip when members or visitors fill in forms. Max length is 250 characters.

Order.description: Sorting order to display the field in UI.

AllowedValues.description: List of allowed values for this field. This data is used for Choice and MultipleChoice fields, otherwise it will be ignored.

ExistsInLevels.description: Collection of membership levels where the field exists. If empty collection provided, it means the field would be available for all levels.

ProrateInApplication.description: Whether the cost should be prorated over a partial period of time. Used only by fields with an associated cost.

allOf.description: Link to unpaid invoice, related to pending membership application.

AllowedActions.description: List of allowed actions related to contact. Each action is described with title and URL, which should be used in POST request.

MultiplierType.description:
Indicates the type of multiplier field.
  ItemPrice multiplier specifies a price for each requested item.
  Percentage multiplier specifies a percent of field value to use as extra charge.

Multiplier.description: value of multiplier for extra charge calculation

MinAmount.description: Minimal amount of items to request (minimal field value). For ItemPrice multiplier type only.

MaxAmount.description: Maximum amount of items to request (maximum field value). For ItemPrice multiplier type only.

MinCharge.description: Minimal extra charge. (minimal field value). For Percentage multiplier type only.

MaxCharge.description: Maximum extra charge. (maximum field value). For Percentage multiplier type only.

ExtraCharge.title: ExtraChargeOptions
ExtraCharge.description: This property appears for CalculatedExtraCharge fields only.

MemberFieldAccess.title: MemberAccess
MemberFieldAccess.description: Controls whether the member is allowed to view or modify this field. Only for member fields.

PublicCanApply.description: Indicates if non-member can apply for membership with this level.

Type.description: Indicates if membership level is individual or bundle.

BundleMembersLimit.description: Maximum number of bundle members. Empty for individuals.

MembershipFee.description: Price of being a member with this level of membership. Price is for RenewalPeriod.

MemberCanChangeToLevels.description: Member can switch from current level to one of levels from this list.

StartFromJoinDate.description: Indicates if renewal period starts from join date. Otherwise, starts from dates specified in Dates field.

Dates.description: Collection of renewal dates during a year.

AutomaticRecurringPayments.description: Indicates if recurring payments will be charged automatically.

Id.description: Item identifier unique in the list

SelectedByDefault.description: Indicates whether this option would be selected on form if user did not select another option.

ExtraCost.description: Extra price for selecting this option. Used only by fields with an associated cost.

IncludeInRenewals.description: Indicates if the field should be shown in renewal form.

AllowedToChangeInRenewal.description: Indicates whether field value can be changed during renual process. Can be set to TRUE only if IncludeInRenewals is set to TRUE.

RenewalPolicy.description: Defines how system manages field during renewal process. Used only by multichoice fields with an associated cost.

Link.description: Url of the rules and terms document.

RulesAndTermsInfo.description: Additional info for fields with rules / terms conditions. Not present for other field types.

items.description: Contact IDs found by Saved Search.

EventId.description: Identifier of existing event you want to clone.

TitlePrefix.description: Prefix to be added to the event title to form the new title. For example if you are cloning the event "Annual meetup" and the prefix is "yet another ", then the new event will have the title "yet another Annual meetup".

CreatedDate.description: Date and time when the draft was created.

Subject.description: Value for email subject. It may contain macros, which will be replaced before delivery.

Body.description: Value for email body. Usually it is HTML content with macros, which will be replaced before delivery.

ReplyToAddress.description: Email address to use as reply to.

EventId.description: Event identifier for which the draft has been started (if any).

IsLinkTrackingAllowed.description: Indicates if email tracking is enabled for this email.

LastChangedDate.description: Date and time when the draft was last modified.

IsScheduled.description: Indicates if draft delivery is scheduled for a particular date. See ScheduledDate value.

ScheduledDate.description: Date and time when the draft will be sent.

Body.description: Email body HTML with mosros applied.

EmailDraftPreview.description: Describes how email will look like when all macros are applied.

EmailsIdentifiers.description: A collection of email log record identifiers.

SentDate.description: Date when email sending was started.

Recipient.description: only if email has a single recipient

Id.description:
If email was sent to individual recipient, this field contains contact identifier.
If email was sent to all recipients from some saved search, this field contains saved search identifier.

Name.description: Display name of recipient or name of saved search.

Email.description: recipient email. for IndividualRecipient and SentEmailRecipient types only

ContextEventId.description: context event identifier. not required. for Event related recipient types only

ScheduleDate.description: Date and time scheduled for sending.

IsScheduled.description: Indicates if draft is scheduled for delivery. Set False to pause.

EmailType.description: The reason why the email was sent.

Subject.description: Subject of email message. May contain macros.

Body.description: Email body in HTML format. May contain macros.

EventId.description:
Unique event identifier. Required if email should be sent to event-related recipients, e.g. all attendees.
  See EmailRecipient description for details.

RegistrationTypeId.description: Unique identifier of event registration type

IsCheckedIn.description: Indicates if registrant is already checked in for event.

RegistrationFee.description: The fee for this registration including all extra charges and taxes.

PaidSum.description: The sum that the registrant has already paid for the registration.

IsPaid.description: Indicates if the registrant has already paid for the registration.

RegistrationFields.description: A collection of registration fields values

ShowToPublic.description: Indicates whether this registration can be shown to other event registrants.

RegistrationDate.description: Date and time when registration was created. (Account local time)

Memo.description: Some additional notes about this registration.

IsGuestRegistration.description: Boolean. True if this is a guest registration, otherwise false.

RecreateInvoice.description: Optional boolean value. If specified and equals true, related invoice will be automatically updated (or created) to match selected registration type and extra cost options.

OnWaitlist.description: True if this is a waitlisted registration, otherwise false.

RegistrationTypeId.description: Unique identifier of event registration type

IsCheckedIn.description: Indicates if registrant is already checked in on event.

RegistrationFields.description: A collection of registration fields values

ShowToPublic.description: Indicates whether this registration can be shown to other event registrants.

RegistrationDate.description: Date and time when registration was created. (Account local time)

Memo.description: Some additional notes about this registration.

RecreateInvoice.description: Optional boolean value. If specified and equals true, related invoice will be automatically updated (or created) to match selected registration type and extra cost options.

RegistrationTypeId.description: Unique identifier of event registration type

IsCheckedIn.description: Indicates if registrant is already checked in on event.

RegistrationFields.description: A collection of registration fields values

ShowToPublic.description: Indicates whether this registration can be shown to other event registrants.

Memo.description: Some additional notes about this registration.

RecreateInvoice.description: Optional boolean value. If specified and equals true, related invoice will be automatically updated (or created) to match selected registration type and extra cost options.

EventRegistrationsResponse.description: List of event registrations that matches request criteria.

Url.description: Event Url to get event details from API.

StartDate.description: Date and time when the event is scheduled to start.

EndDate.description: Date and time when the event is scheduled to end. Could be empty.

Location.description: Location where the event will take place.

NumberOfGuests.description: Number of guests registered along with the registrant. If event registration type requires guests registration with details (contact information, etc.), this value is 0.

NumberOfGuestsCheckedIn.description: Number of guests who already checked in. If event registration type requires guests registration with details (contact information, etc.), this value is null.

GuestRegistrations.description: List of guest registrations links. If event registration type expects guest registration by number (without contact information), this value is null. This value cannot be saved or updated using API.

Id.description: Unique event identifier. This field should be provided only when updating existing event registration type

EventId.description: Identifier of event related to the registration type.

Name.description: Registraton type title. This field should be provided only when creating new registration type

IsEnabled.description: Indicates whether this registration type is enabled

Description.description: Plain text description for the event registration type.

BasePrice.description: Base price registrant pays with this registration type.

UseTaxScopeSettings.description: Indicates whether account tax scope settings should be used to calculate final price.  Once set, it has to be provided on every update. Otherwise, it will be overwritten to default value

RegistrationCode.description: Registration code required to apply for event with this registration type. This property has value only if Availability is CodeRequired.

AvailableForMembershipLevels.description: Which membership levels can apply for event. This property has value only if Availability is MembersOnly.

AvailableFrom.description: This registration type is available starting from this date. Can be null.  Once set, it has to be provided on every update. Otherwise, it will be overwritten to null

AvailableThrough.description: This registration type is available until this date. Can be null.  Once set, it has to be provided on every update. Otherwise, it will be overwritten to null

MaximumRegistrantsCount.description: Maximum number of registrants for this registration type.

CancellationDaysBeforeEvent.description: If CancellationBehaviour = AllowUpToPeriodBeforeEvent, this field contains minimum number of days before the event that cancellations are allowed

IsWaitlistEnabled.description: Indicated whether registrant should be placed on waitlist if registrations have reached their limit.

Id.description: Unique identifier of event. This field should be provided only when updating existing event.

EventType.description: Indicates if event is simple (RSVP) or regular.

StartDate.description: Date and time when the event is scheduled to start.

StartTimeSpecified.description: Indicates if event start time is specified. False means that StartDate contains only date component.

EndDate.description: Date and time when the event is scheduled to end. Could be empty.

EndTimeSpecified.description: Indicates if event end time is specified. False means that EndDate contains only date component.

Location.description: Location where the event will take place.

RegistrationEnabled.description: Indicates that registration to this event is enabled

Tags.description: A collection of tags associated with the event.

Sessions.description: Collection of event sessions. Exist in multisessions events only.

RegistrationsLimit.description: Maximum number of registrations for this event.

DescriptionHtml.description: Full event description in HTML format.

PaymentInstructions.description: A description how attendee can pay for attendance in this event. Payment instructions for this event only.

RegistrationConfirmationExtraInfo.description: Additional event information to be inserted in registration confirmation email

RegistrationMessage.description: This text will be shown above Register button on Event details

SendEmailCopy.description: Indicates if email copy should be sent according to email routing setting.

IsWaitlistEnabled.description: Indicates if waitlist feature is enabled to the event.

MultipleRegistrationAllowed.description: Indicates if it is allowed to have multiple registrations for the same contact.

CheckedInGuests.description: For event registrations with anonymous guests (guests as number), sets number of checked-in guests.

EventType.description: Indicates if event is simple (RSVP) or regular.

StartDate.description: Date and time when the event is scheduled to start.

StartTimeSpecified.description: Indicates if event start time is specified. False means that StartDate contains only date component.

EndDate.description: Date and time when the event is scheduled to end. Could be empty.

EndTimeSpecified.description: Indicates if event end time is specified. False means that EndDate contains only date component.

Location.description: Location where the event will take place.

RegistrationEnabled.description: Indicates whether registration to this event is enabled

HasEnabledRegistrationTypes.description: Indicates that at least one registration type is enabled for this event.

Tags.description: A collection of tags associated with the event.

Sessions.description: Collection of event sessions. Exist in multisessions events only.

RegistrationsLimit.description: Maximum number of registrations for this event.

PendingRegistrationsCount.description: Number of participants already registered for this event but not confirmed yet.

ConfirmedRegistrationsCount.description: Number of participants already registered for this event and already confirmed.

CheckedInAttendeesNumber.description: Number of attendees already checked in on this event.

AvailableForAnyLevel.description: If AccessLevel is Restricted, then indicates if the event is available to any member on any level.

AvailableForLevels.description:
Event is available to members who are on these levels.
This field appears only if AccessLevel is Restricted and AvailableForAnyLevel is false.

AvailableForAnyGroup.description: If AccessLevel is Restricted, then indicates if the event is available to any member in any membership group.

AvailableForGroups.description:
Event is available to members who are any of these groups.
This field appears only if AccessLevel is Restricted and AvailableForAnyGroup is false.

EventAccessLevel.description:
Event accessability.
  - Public means event accessible for everyone
  - AdminOnly means event accessible for administrators only
  - Restricted means event accessible for specific membership levels or groups.

allOf.description: Indicates who is allowed to see list of event registrants.

ShowPendingAttendees.description: Indicates if pending registrants should be included in the list of registrants.

EventAttendeesDisplaySettings.description: Settings for section "List of event registrants" on UI.

DescriptionHtml.description: Full event description in HTML format. Important - Links to images can be relative.

PaymentInstructions.description: A description how registrant can pay for attendance to this event. Payment instructions for this event only.

RegistrationTypes.description: Collection of configured registration types for the event.

EventRegistrationFields.description: Collection of fields registrant should fill during registration process.

TotalPaid.description: Total sum paid for all registrations to this event. This is a read-only property.

TotalDue.description: Total sum due, but not necessarily paid yet for all registrations related to this event. This is a read-only property.

allOf.description: Link to contact who is designated as organizer for this event.

RegistrationConfirmationExtraInfo.description: Additional event information to be inserted in registration confirmation email

RegistrationMessage.description: This text will be shown above Register button on Event details

SendEmailCopy.description: Indicates if email copy should be sent according to email routing settings.

IsWaitlistEnabled.description: Indicates if waitlist feature is enabled for the event.

MultipleRegistrationAllowed.description: Indicates if multiple registrations are allowed for the same contact.

EventGuestRegistrationPolicy.description:
Describes how guests are registered. Allowed values are
- Disabled - guest registration is not allowed - NumberOfGuests - number of guests should be specified. - CollectContactDetails - contact information should be collected for each guest. - CollectFullInfo - full registration info should be collected for each guest.

Enabled.description: Indicates if guest registrations are allowed.

CreateContactMode.description: Indicates whether guests are automatically added to database after the main registrant confirms the registration

EventGuestRegistrationSettings.description: Control how system works with guest registrations for specific event.

NotResponded.description: Number of invitees who did not respond yet.

NotAttended.description: Number of invitees who answered NO to the invite.

Attended.description: Number of invitees who answered YES to the invite.

MaybeAttended.description: Number of invitees who answered MAY BE to the invite.

EventInviteeStatistics.description: Statistics related to invitees to RSVP events.

EventPaymentMethodType.description:
How attendees can pay for the ticket.

  - OnlineAndOffline
  - OfflineOnly
  - OnlineOnly

EventRegistrationCancellationBehavior.description: Indicates if it is possible for attendee to self-cancel event registration.

Kind.description: Indicated is the field is common for all contacts or custom for the event.

IsEnabled.description: Indicates whether this registration type is enabled

EventId.description: Identifier of event related to the registration type.

Description.description: Plain text description for the event registration type.

BasePrice.description: Base price registrant pays for this registration type.

UseTaxScopeSettings.description: Indicates whether account tax scope settings should be used to calculate final price.

RegistrationCode.description: Registration code required to apply for event with this registration type. This property has value only if Availability is CodeRequired.

AvailableForMembershipLevels.description: Which membership levels can apply for event. This property has value only if Availability is MembersOnly.

AvailableFrom.description: This registration type is available starting from this date. Can be null.

AvailableThrough.description: This registration type is available until this date. Can be null.

MaximumRegistrantsCount.description: Maximum number of registrants for this registration type.

CurrentRegistrantsCount.description: Current number of registrants for this registration type.

CancellationDaysBeforeEvent.description: In case if CancellationBehaviour = AllowUpToPeriodBeforeEvent, this field indicates the minimum number of days before the event that cancellations are allowed.

IsWaitlistEnabled.description: Indicated if registrant should be added to waitlist if registrations have reached their limit.

EventRegistrationTypeAvailability.description: Indicates who the registration type is available to.

EventRegistrationTypeResponse.description: List of event registration types that match the request criteria.

EventRegistrationUnavailabilityPolicy.description: Indicates what is displayed if the registration type is not available for a particular visitor.

StartDate.description: Date and time when the event session is scheduled to start.

StartTimeSpecified.description: Indicates if session start time is specified. False means that StartDate contains only date component.

EndDate.description: Date and time when the event session is scheduled to end. Could be empty.

EndTimeSpecified.description: Indicates if session end time is specified. False means that EndDate contains only date component.

WaitlistType.description:
Indicates how the waitlist works for the event.

 - None - waitlist is not enabled
 - Manual - people can be added to a waitlist and then automatically registered in the order they were added, as sufficient spaces open up
 - Auto - people can be added to a waitlist and then manually registered by an administrator or by themselves once spaces become available

InformationToCollect.description: Indicates what information should be collected for people being added to the waitlist.

Count.description: Number of events that match request criteria. This field appears only if $count parameter was passed in request.

Events.description: List of events that match request criteria.

EventsIdentifiers.description: List of event identifiers that match request criteria. The field appears only if idsOnly parameter was passed in request.

allOf.description: Link to contact assigned to the financial document.

CreatedDate.description: Date and time when the document was created.

allOf.description: Link to contact who created the document. Could be null.

Payments.description: List of payments that match request criteria.

Items.description: List of audit log items that match request criteria.

allOf.description: Link to related contact.

OrderType.description: The origin of the audit log entry.

Properties.description: Collection of audit log item properties that contains all technical information about transaction and other linked documents.

allOf.description: Link to related document.

DocumentAction.description: Action performed on related document type.

Invoices.description: If not null or empty then invoices with these IDs will be settled to new payment.

allOf.description: Link to contact who made the payment.

Comment.description: Internal note on payment. Visible to administrators only.

PublicComment.description: Comment to payor. Visible to both administrators and payor.

Comment.description: Internal note on refund. Visible to administrators only.

PublicComment.description: Comment on refund. Visible to both administrators and the person being refunded.

SettledValue.description: The previously settled amount of the payment.

UpdatedDate.description: Date and time when the document was last modified.  Could be null.

Memo.description: Internal note on invoice. Visible to administrators only.

PublicMemo.description: Comment on invoice. Visible to both administrators and the person being invoicec.

allOf.description: Link to contact who is assigned to the financial document.

CreatedDate.description: Date and time when the document was created.

allOf.description: Link to contact who created the document. Could be null.

UpdatedDate.description: Date and time when the document was last modified.  Could be null.

allOf.description: Link to contact who modified the document. Could be null.

IsPaid.description: Indicates if the invoice is fully paid.

PaidAmount.description: Sum already paid for this invoice.

allOf.description: Link to related event registration or null.

Memo.description: Internal note on invoice. Visible to administrators only.

PublicMemo.description: Comment on invoice. Visible to both administrators and the person being invoiced.

VoidedDate.description: When invoice is voided this field indicates date of void. Voided invoice does not affect balance. For regular invoices this field is null.

InvoiceIdentifiers.description: List of invoices identifiers that match request criteria. The field appears if idsOnly parameter was passed in request.

Invoices.description: List of invoices that match request criteria.

Value.description: Sum to pay for this item. Can be negative (discounts).

Comment.description: Internal note on payment. Visible to administrators only.

PublicComment.description: Comment on payment. Visible to both administrators and payors.

AllocatedValue.description: Total amount allocated to another finance documents (invoices or refunds).

allOf.description: Link to related invoice.
Link to related payment.

PaymentAllocation.description: Thhis object describes how payment is allocated among invoices.

PaymentIdentifiers.description: List of payment identifiers that match request criteria. The field appears if idsOnly parameter was passed in request.

Comment.description: Internal note on refund. Visible to administrators only.

PublicComment.description: Comment on refund. Visible to both administrators and person being refunded.

SettledValue.description: Total amount allocated to another finance documents (payments or donations).

RefundIdentifiers.description: List of refund identifiers that match request criteria. The field appears if idsOnly parameter was passed in request.

Refunds.description: List of refunds that match request criteria.

SalesTax.description: Taxes applied to the invoice according to account Tax Rules settings.

Amount.description: total gross amount including all taxes

RoundedAmount.description: rounded total amount including all taxes

allOf.description: applied Tax 1 description
applied Tax 2 description

SalesTaxInfo.description: Describe taxes applied to this invoice item

IsCustom.description: Indicates that this tender is created by account admin, otherwise the tender is built-in.

Id.description: Identifier of the invoice to update

Comment.description: Internal note on payment. Visible to administrators only.

PublicComment.description: Comment on payment. Visible to both administrators and payors.

AllocatedValue.description: Total amount allocated to another finance documents (invoices or refunds).

Comment.description: Internal note on refund. Visible to administrators only.

PublicComment.description: Comment on refund. Visible to both administrators and person being refunded.

SettledValue.description: The previously settled amount of the payment.

ObjectType.description: Object type which was requested. In this case it is always Contact.

FilterExpression.description: Value of $filter parameter passed into API.

SelectExpression.description: Value of $select parameter passed into API.

ReturnIds.description: Indicates if client requested only a list of identifiers, instead of full list of contacts.

Id.description: ID of membership level to assign.

PrepayRequired.description: If true, membership fee should be received in full before application is activated. Else, approved memberships activate immediately, regardless of payment status.

AdminApprovalRequired.description:
Indicates that account administrator should approve membership application.
False means that all applications are considered approved when they are submitted.

EventDetailsEditParams_Organizer.description: Link to contact, who is set as organizer for this event.

Id.description: ID of contact to whom the invoice is assigned.
ID of contact who created the document. Could be null.
ID of contact who modified the document. Could be null.

pagingSkip.name: $skip
pagingSkip.description:
'Specifies the number of records to skip (not include in a result set). For example if you expect about 300 records in result set and want to get them in small portions, you could make do so with 3 calls:'
- ...&$top=100 - will return records from 0 to 99 - ...?$skip=100&top=100' - will return records from 100 to 199 - ...?$skip=200' - will return records from 199 to the end

pagingTop.name: $top
pagingTop.description: this parameter specifies the maximum number of entries to be returned

badRequest.description: On invalid parameters. See error details in response body.

termsOfUseRequired.description: Current user should accept terms of use before using API. It can be done in web interface, or by making a POST request to /rpc/{accountId}/acceptTermsOfUse

tooManyRequests.description: Too many requests from same account. Wait for a minute and try again.

unauthorized.description: oAuth token was not provided, invalid or does not provide access to requested URL.
